channel.title: BBC News - Northern Ireland
channel.copyright: Copyright: (C) British Broadcasting Corporation, see http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/help/rss/4498287.stm for terms and conditions of reuse.

item.title: Disability discrimination case settled with PSNI and jobs firm
item.description: An unsuccessful applicant for a PSNI administrative post settles discrimination case for £12,500.

item.title: PIP: Six in 10 disability claimants win case on appeal
item.description: About 60% of the 10,000 appeals made in NI between April 2019 and June 2021 succeeded, the BBC finds.

item.title: Vet unfairly dismissed by Department of Agriculture
item.description: Dr Tamara Bronckaers says she was "excluded, ignored" for raising animal welfare concerns.

item.title: Lyra McKee: Two men charged with rioting and throwing petrol bombs
item.description: The men, aged 24 and 29, are charged with rioting and throwing petrol bombs.

item.title: NI100: Church leaders defend Armagh centenary service
item.description: Irish President Michael D. Higgins decided he would not attend the event last week.

item.title: Irish language and Ulster-Scots strategies 'complex and sensitive'
item.description: No completion date has been set for Irish language and Ulster-Scots strategies promised in 2020 deal.

item.title: Ballybeen: Man shot in both legs in Dundonald
item.description: Police appeal for information following the attack in Kilberry Park, Dundondald, on Thursday night.

item.title: McIlroy paired with Poulter for opening foursomes
item.description: Jon Rahm will play with fellow Spaniard Sergio Garcia against Americans Justin Thomas and Jordan Spieth in the opening foursomes match of the 43rd Ryder Cup.

item.title: Covid-19: October 14 agreed for more changes to NI restrictions
item.description: The executive agrees to ease more of NI's restrictions on 14 October, subject to a review.

item.title: Earl and Countess of Wessex visit Balmoral Show during NI trip
item.description: Prince Edward and Sophie visit the Balmoral show in the final segment of a visit to Northern Ireland.

item.title: Keir Starmer: Labour leader calls on PM to step in over NI Protocol
item.description: Sir Keir Starmer called on Boris Johnson to ensure the Stormont institutions are maintained.

item.title: County Wexford: Light aircraft crash lands on Carne Beach
item.description: Four people were on board the aircraft, however, their injuries are not life threatening.

item.title: Covid-19: NI records eight Covid-linked deaths, 1,165 cases
item.description: The total number of deaths linked to coronavirus in NI since the start of the pandemic is 2,525.

item.title: Coronavirus: Elective surgery hubs planned for winter
item.description: The hubs are to ensure planned operations can continue safely throughout the winter.

item.title: Covid-19: Andrew Girvin feared mother would die from virus he gave her
item.description: Andrew Girvin, who was unvaccinated, says he feared his mother would die after he gave her Covid.

item.title: Covid-19: 'Vaccine misinformation a dilemma for young people'
item.description: NI's mental health champion says it has left young people questioning if Covid jab is safe.

item.title: Teens and over 50s in Northern Ireland to be offered flu jab
item.description: The Department of Health in Northern Ireland is widening the criteria for flu vaccines this year.

item.title: Rihanna's NI video for We Found Love remembered 10 years on
item.description: Ten years on, a farmer recalls a "courteous conversation" with the star after asking her to cover up.

item.title: In pictures: The 2021 Balmoral Show
item.description: Thousands flock to the opening day of the biggest event in Northern Ireland's agri-food calendar

item.title: Latest Northern Ireland weather forecast
item.description: The weather forecast in Northern Ireland.

item.title: Health and social care tax: Who pays for care homes in NI?
item.description: Boris Johnson has announced an extra tax to fund social care but how is it currently funded?

item.title: Rihanna, the farmer, the field and the cover up a decade on
item.description: It's 10 years since a Northern Ireland farmer talked that talk to one of the world's biggest pop stars.

item.title: Earl and Countess of Wessex visit Balmoral Show during NI visit
item.description: The Earl and Countess of Wessex visited a leisure centre in Craigavon and the Balmoral Show.

item.title: 'My husband was given a life sentence with his diagnosis'
item.description: Two women talk about the challenges of getting care for their relatives in Northern Ireland.

item.title: Balmoral Show under way after two-year delay
item.description: Visitors must show proof of full vaccination or a negative Covid test to get into the agricultural event.

item.title: Transfer test plan criticised by Bishop of Derry Donal McKeown
item.description: Donal McKeown says it will lead to the "fragmentation" of decision-making in NI's education system.

item.title: Derry Girls to end after upcoming series
item.description: Creator Lisa McGee says the plan was always "to say goodbye after three series".

item.title: James McKeever: Derry councillor denies historical sex offences
item.description: James McKeever, 63, from Eglinton, faces charges including indecent assault and gross indecency.

item.title: Junior Ogedi-Uzokwe: Online racist abuse of Derry City player 'shameful' - Higgins
item.description: Derry City manager Ruaidhri Higgins says online racist abuse aimed at forward Junior Ogedi-Uzokwe after Monday's 3-3 draw with Bohemians is "shameful".

item.title: Saoirse Ronan: Macbeth and Lady Macbeth are like Kim and Kanye
item.description: The actress says Kim Kardashian has inspired the "uncharted territory" of her first UK stage role.

item.title: Northamptonshire project seeks stories of Irish M1 workers
item.description: A writer aims to collect stories from people who came to England to build the motorway.

item.title: Former Irish rugby international Brendan Mullin accused of stealing €578,000
item.description: Brendan Mullin, 57, faces nine counts of theft and five of false accounting.

item.title: People 'spread Covid disinformation' at Letterkenny hospital
item.description: A video shows a patient being encouraged to leave the hospital in one of two incidents in recent days.

item.title: Politicians condemn protest at Leo Varadkar's home
item.description: Protesters gathered outside the home of the tánaiste (Ireland's deputy prime minister) on Sunday.
